slides.title: Enterprise Dominance
slides.description: .NET remains a top choice for large enterprises worldwide, powering mission-critical systems in finance, healthcare, and government, ensuring long-term demand for skilled developers.

slides.title: Cross-Platform Power
slides.description: .NET runs seamlessly on Windows, Linux, and macOS, allowing developers to build and deploy applications anywhere with consistent performance.

slides.title: High Performance
slides.description: .NET delivers industry-leading speed and efficiency, making it ideal for high-traffic APIs, cloud services, and performance-critical applications.

slides.title: Cloud Native Ready
slides.description: .NET integrates deeply with cloud platforms like Azure and supports containers, microservices, and serverless architectures out of the box.

slides.title: Strong Job Market
slides.description: .NET developers continue to see strong global demand, competitive salaries, and stable career opportunities across many industries.

slides.title: Modern Language Features
slides.description: C# continues to evolve with concise syntax, strong typing, and modern paradigms that improve productivity and code quality.

slides.title: Unified Ecosystem
slides.description: .NET provides a single ecosystem for web, desktop, mobile, cloud, IoT, and game development, reducing the need to learn multiple stacks.

slides.title: Open Source Backing
slides.description: .NET is fully open source with strong community contributions, rapid innovation, and transparency backed by Microsoft.

slides.title: Excellent Tooling
slides.description: Visual Studio and related tools offer powerful debugging, profiling, and productivity features that accelerate development cycles.

slides.title: Long-Term Stability
slides.description: .NET emphasizes backward compatibility and long-term support releases, making it a safe and reliable technology investment for 2026 and beyond.
